title: Issue generating AST from bytes literal

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Bug that shouldn't change language semantics when fixed.

body:
Originally reported by @banteg at https://github.com/eth-brownie/brownie/issues/771

The following contract fails when attempting to generate certain types of outputs:

```python
# @version 0.2.4
from vyper.interfaces import ERC20

uniswap: constant(address) = 0x7a250d5630B4cF539739dF2C5dAcb4c659F2488D

@external
def swap(token_in: address, token_out: address, amount_in: uint256, min_amount_out: uint256, to: address):
    ERC20(token_in).transferFrom(msg.sender, self, ERC20(token_in).balanceOf(msg.sender))
    selector: Bytes[4] = b"\x38\xed\x17\x39"
    response: Bytes[128] = raw_call(
        uniswap,
        concat(
            selector,                               # swapExactTokensForTokens
            convert(amount_in, bytes32),            # amount_in
            convert(min_amount_out, bytes32),       # min_amount_out
            convert(160, bytes32),                  # path[] payload offset
            convert(to, bytes32),                   # to
            convert(block.timestamp + 1, bytes32),  # deadline
            convert(2, bytes32),                    # path[] payload lengtgh
            convert(token_in, bytes32),             # path[0]
            convert(token_out, bytes32),            # path[1]
        ),
        max_outsize=128                             # returns uint[] amounts
    )
```

With `ast_dict` as the target output:

```python
  File "/home/computer/code/python/vyper/vyper/ast/utils.py", line 35, in parse_to_ast
    raise SyntaxException(str(e), source_code, e.lineno, e.offset) from e
vyper.exceptions.SyntaxException: bytes can only contain ASCII literal characters. (<unknown>, line 10)
  line 10:26 
        9     ERC20(token_in).transferFrom(msg.sender, self, ERC20(token_in).balanceOf(msg.sender))
  ---> 10     selector: Bytes[4] = b"8Ã­9"
  ----------------------------------^
       11     response: Bytes[128] = raw_call(
```
